critique: This document revokes a previous executive order related to the Federal Energy Office and clarifies the status of regulations and authorities following the Federal Energy Administration Act Amendments of 1976. It primarily deals with the continuity of existing regulations and authorities within the Federal Energy Administration. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, expansion of executive power, or impact on social inclusion. The document seems to maintain the status quo regarding federalism and national security vs. civil liberties. It appears to have a slight deregulation aspect by revoking the previous order, but it mainly ensures the continuation of existing regulations under the amended act.
